alert.note: Alert for Caledonia; Orange (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 8:30PM EST until December 19 at 9:36AM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Gray ME has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in New Hampshire...Vermont... Connecticut River At Wells River affecting Orange, Grafton and Caledonia Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Connecticut River at Wells River. * WHEN...From this evening to late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Low lying farmland near the river begins to flood initially on the Vermont side. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:16 PM EST Monday the stage was 11.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:16 PM EST Monday was 11.1 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 11.2 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight to 8.4 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will rise to 10.2 feet early Wednesday morning. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/gray.
